pyadapt.datastreams.sounding module¶

class pyadapt.datastreams.sounding.SOUNDING(F, kind)[source]¶

Bases: pyadapt.datastreams.default.ARMCLASS

Defines a SOUNDING class

This particular class defines a sounding. It uses as input a netcdf file that has been detected as a sounding.

plot(altmax=10000, kind='simple', plot_output=False, out_dir='', out_name='', out_fmt='png', autoname=True)[source]¶

plot a sounding for quick visualization

you can set altmax (in meters) and an output file in out if you want. currently kind doesn’t work, but will eventually support choosing

between a normal height/temp plot and a skew-t
example:
S.plot(altmax=3000, out=’sample_out.png’)
supported output types:
anything that matplotlib can normally output, such as png, eps, pdf
